content.description:
An elementary step in a reaction mechanism is given.

<math alttext="2 N O B r reacts to produce 2 N O plus B r 2" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>NOBr</mtext> <mo>â†’</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>NO</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>Br</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </math>
content.question: Which of the following diagrams would best help explain why not all collisions result in reaction?

choices.label: The figure shows a diagram of two N O B r molecules, one on the left and the other on the right. The atoms are shown as circles. The N atom is the central atom in the molecules and the B r atom is much larger than the N atom and the O atom. In the molecule on the left, the B r atom is on the right side of the molecule, and in the molecule on the right, the B r atom is on the left side of the molecule. Arrows show that the molecules are moving toward each other.

The figure shows a diagram of two N O B r molecules, one on the left and the other on the right. The atoms are shown as circles. The N atom is the central atom in the molecules and the B r atom is much larger than the N atom and the O atom. In the molecule on the left, the B r atom is on the right side of the molecule, and in the molecule on the right, the B r atom is on the bottom of the molecule. Arrows show that the molecules are moving toward each other.

The figure shows a diagram of two N O B r molecules, one on the left and the other on the right. The atoms are shown as circles. The N atom is the central atom in the molecules and the B r atom is much larger than the N atom and the O atom. The B r atom is on the bottom of both molecules. Arrows show that the molecules are moving toward each other.

The figure shows a diagram of two N O B r molecules, one on the left and the other on the right. The atoms are shown as circles. The N atom is the central atom in the molecules and the B r atom is much larger than the N atom and the O atom. The B r atom is on the right side of both molecules. Arrows show that the molecules are moving toward each other.

content.answer: The figure shows a diagram of two N O B r molecules, one on the left and the other on the right. The atoms are shown as circles. The N atom is the central atom in the molecules and the B r atom is much larger than the N atom and the O atom. The B r atom is on the right side of both molecules. Arrows show that the molecules are moving toward each other.

skill.text: 4.B: Explain whether a model is consistent with chemical theories.
